reviewText:
Fans and gamers were spoilt with Tomb Raider - the rebooted origin tale of the titular Lara Croft - and this wonderful behind-the-scenes digital book companion will offer great insight into how it all happened. Veteran journalist Geoff Keighley provides a relatively comprehensive look at the design process, showcasing many concepts that never made it to the finished game, as well as artwork, sketches, interviews and reports on how Crystal Dynamics recreated the video game icon.

This well designed application is best used on a tablet computer, but can be enjoyed just as easily on a desktop. Additionally, there are interactive elements, such as panoramas of the developer's studio and a music mixer. Much of the video content is actually streamed rather than downloaded with the application, but I found the content both new and good quality.

While everything is well designed and easy to navigate, I found the content lacking. The whole book can be read in just over an hour, and there is little beyond the abandoned concepts that proves truly captivating. For those who have followed previews, the content could be considered lightweight. And for those who haven't, there isn't a great deal on offer to make this a must-buy.

For Lara Croft fans, this is a fine addition to a wonderful game, and for those interested in the development process, Tomb Raider - The Final Hours offers a glimpse behind the curtain into the industry and the pressure to reboot gaming royalty. Overall, however, this is just an optional add on that offers little value for money and should only be purchased as part of a collector's edition. There just isn't enough content to justify its asking price.

For the fans.

6.5/10.

reviewText:
Well, some people might say that this would be a waste of Money.
I strongly disagree.

Sure this could have been free Bonus content, but im still happy about this purchase.

First of all, this is not a Game, obviously.
I would call it an interactive Guide about the 2013 release of Tomb Raider.

It features some interesting background Stories about Tomb Raider itself and its developement, about the Developers, the Music and Soundeffects of the Game and also shows deleted Scenes.
It contains Videos as well as reading Passages, interactive Tours through Parts the Game, some insights of the Crystal Dynamic Studios, Polls and a lot of amazing Artwork.

Only negative aspect is the Price, you can argue that it might be a little too high for about 1 Hour of content.

Anyway, i would suggest buying this for everyone who loved playing Tomb Raider, or for People that are unsure about purchasing it.
voteText: 14 of 24 people (58%) found this review helpful 3 people found this review funny

reviewText: DLC verdict: Get it on sale\n\nComment: Contrary to my previous belief this is not a real DLC for the game. Instead it has its' own entry in the Steam Library and starts up with an executable file. It DOES NOT ADD TO GAME. What it does is that it shows us a documentary of how Tomb Raider was made. With that comes concept art, unused/cut content, the backstory of the franchize and the devs. There are also videos which open up and most of them are a narrative series lead by Zach Levi as he shows us the people involved in TR. Unfortunately most of THESE ARE YOUTUBE VIDEOS (7 in total). Meaning that you will not be able to view them if a video is taken down/broken/restricted in a country. I already had 1 link to a private video there. So it boils down on how much you like Crystal Dynamics and documentaries. If not much, you can pass and won't miss this. For fans - get it on sale!
voteText: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
OverviewAt first I was a little worried about buying the final hours book, as many other people had said that there really isn't much content here. To put it simply, there isn't. But what's there is really good. If you're a fan of the tomb raider series (and thats every game mind you) then you will enjoy the content in this. There are lots of cool exclusive, behind-the-scenes videos to be seen here. There is also a final hours series of videos that include interviews with people at crystal dynamics etc. However, be warned that whilst the final hours videos aren't included on the PC version of Tomb Raider 2013, they are included on the PS3 and XBOX 360 versions of the game. Not sure about the definitive edition.
Back to the book however, the information is well written and interesting to read. There are also lots of interactive sequences, such as one where you can compare the in-game Lara's face and the model's face that she was based on.

Positive
+ Interactive Sections
+ Easy to Read
+ Behind the Scenes Videos

Negative
- Not much content

ConclusionA good and interesting look at how Crystal Dynamics reinvented the Tomb Raider franchise, reccommended for fans of the franchise but be warned that there isn't a huge amount of content on offer.

reviewText: The Final Hours of Tomb Raider turned out to be extremely educational and really illuminated the process that goes into making a quality video game such as the reinvention of our beloved Tomb Raider. I really enjoyed the implementation of the videos and the behind the scenes look at thier studios. I really believe they are taking the franchise in the right direction. There are many reasons why Tomb Raider has become my single favorite video game and in part because of the wonderful community that surrounds it. Overall, making this documentary wasn't needed but it was an excellent piece to an already near perfect release. Oh, and the new face of Tomb Raider is absolutely gorgeous as the tradition of the character.

reviewText:
툼레이더(2013)와 관련한 디지털 북이라길래 그냥 DLC 개념으로 툼레이더 폴더에 PDF 파일 하나 추가되는가 싶었는데, 아예 라이브러리에 별도의 프로그램이 등록됩니다. 거기다 단순 PDF 파일이 아니고, 어도비 에어와 플래시를 이용한 하나의 프로그램으로서 실행해보면 각 페이지 안에 동영상이나 이미지들이 적절하게 표현되어 있습니다. 디지털 북은 이래야한다는 걸 아주 잘 보여주고 있습니다.

영어의 압박으로 자세한 내용을 보지 못했지만, 제작 과정, 삭제된 장면, 삭제된 컨셉, 삭제된 무기 등을 볼 수 있었는데 만드는데 분명 많은 수고가 들어간 부분들을 과감하게 삭제했고 결과적으로 명작이 되었다는데 놀랐습니다.

툼레이더에 관심이 있으시다면 스팀 할인 때 구매할 가치는 충분히 있습니다.

reviewText: How did Crystal Dynamics reinvent Tomb Raider? The Final Hours of Tomb Raider is a digital book that takes you inside the studio during the four year development of this franchise reboot. Journalist Geoff Keighley chronicles the team’s journey, illustrating this 11,000 word story with never-before-seen art and videos from parts of the game left on the cutting room floor.

reviewText: The Final Hours is an interactive virtual book, showing us the making and development of Tomb Raider. It's an interesting insight into the making of Tomb Raider and well worth it.
